data.sampled:
2

In Example A, the prompt is "0 1 2 swap over". This command swaps the first two numbers (0 and 1) on the stack. The resulting stack representation after executing this command should be (2 1 0) as shown in the response. So, the response from the assistant is correct in this case.

In Example B, the prompt is "1 2 dup rot over swap nip tuck". This command duplicates the first number on the stack (1), rotates the top 3 numbers to the right by one index (0 2 2 1), overwrites the third number with the top of the stack (2 1 2), and then tucks the top of the stack (nip tuck) to bring the first number back to the top. The resulting stack representation after executing this command should be (2 1 1) as shown in the response.
